citation.title: Paleoecology of Miocene crocodylians in Florida: Insights from stable isotope analysis

news.title: Evolution hasn't revamped alligators in 8 million years - Futurity
news.summary: While many of today’s top predators are more recent products of evolution, the modern American alligator is a reptile from another time.

news.title: American Alligator’s Lineage is More Ancient than Previously Thought | Biology, Paleontology | Sci-News.com
news.summary: According to new research, American alligators (Alligator mississippiensis) have remained virtually untouched by evolutionary change for at least 8 million years — up to 6 million years older than previously thought.

news.title: Alligators haven’t changed in millions of years, study finds - Redorbit
news.summary: Science September 20, 2016 While most of today's predators have honed their hunting attributes over the last few million years, the American alligator stopped a long time ago-- and they seem to be getting along just fine.
